known_topics: User asked whether open-source models can have long-term memory like ChatGPT/Claude/Gemini.
Assistant explained: long-term memory is typically an external system (store + retrieval) rather than model weight updates.
Assistant proposed an MCP-based memory architecture: document truth (file-first) + structured memory store + vector search + policy engine + MCP tools/resources.
User requested: a Codex Agent prompt to generate the MCP memory system and an export of known memory/context to seed the server.
not_included: No full workspace document contents were provided beyond ai_context.zip git metadata.
No personal identifiers beyond those explicitly provided by user profile were added.

seed_memories.content: User prefers to be addressed as Victor.
seed_memories.title: Preferred name

seed_memories.content: User maintains five domains/projects in ChatGPT web: product-research, recipes, car-care, personal-finance, 3d-printing.
seed_memories.title: User ChatGPT project domains

seed_memories.content: Within a Project, the Project’s files are the source of truth; prefer reading manifest.json, adapter JSON, and library_index.json before deep work.
seed_memories.title: Project files are source of truth

seed_memories.content: Each Project has: manifest.json, library_index.json, and exactly one adapter JSON (e.g., iac.gpt.research_analysis.v1). Adapters define defaults.collection and schemas.
seed_memories.title: Project structure conventions

seed_memories.content: When the user says “save/add/update”, generate a normalized JSON record (op, adapter, collection, key, record_type, payload, provenance, optional hash_sha256) and offer a file named <collection>__<key>__YYYYMMDD.json plus an optional tiny library_index patch.
seed_memories.title: Saving workflow via JSON file generation

seed_memories.content: Prefer minimal data collection; avoid sensitive identifiers unless user provides them; keep outputs share-safe.
seed_memories.title: Privacy preference: minimal data collection

seed_memories.content: Prefer primary sources and official docs; for product info also prefer Consumer Reports, Wirecutter, reputable government/standards sources; credible Reddit threads can be used cautiously when synthesizing user reviews; cite clearly.
seed_memories.title: Citation/source preferences

seed_memories.content: For critical numbers, do careful explicit calculations (digit-by-digit where appropriate), show working, and state assumptions/uncertainty.
seed_memories.title: Math/accuracy preference

seed_memories.content: Use the active Project’s timezone if specified by its files; otherwise assume the user’s local time. Use absolute dates to clarify relative terms like “today/this week.”
seed_memories.title: Time/date handling preference

seed_memories.content: Default response format: 5–8 line executive summary first, then structured details (tables/bullets/metrics). Flag biases, missing data, and opposing views.
seed_memories.title: Output structure preference

seed_memories.content: Ask up to 2 targeted clarifying questions only when essential; otherwise proceed with explicit assumptions.
seed_memories.title: Clarifying questions limit

seed_memories.content: User wants an MCP-based memory system for their workspace and an instruction prompt to run with Codex Agent to generate it.
seed_memories.title: Current goal
